newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Three killed in new clashes at S.Africa gold mine.
newsitem.headline: Three killed in new clashes at S.Africa gold mine.

text.p: Three South African miners were killed overnight in renewed ethnic clashes at Buffelsfontein gold mine southwest of Johannesburg, taking the death toll since the weekend to 24, police said on Thursday.
They said another three people had been injured in the fighting between Xhosa and Sotho workers at a mine hostel, one of them critically.
Buffelsfontein Gold Mining Company Ltd, near Klerksdorp 160 km (100 miles) southwest of Johannesburg, is owned by Randgold & Exploration Co Ltd.
The company said on Wednesday that output had not been affected by the violence.
